dataset.title: Chlorophyll a of Lake Cedrino and Temo (SI001231 Sardinian Lake Ecosystems) in 2012

section.para: This dataset includes chlorophyll a data taken in two research sites (Lake Cedrino and Temo) of the site Sardinian Lake Ecosystems as part of LTER Italy. Samples were collected as representative of each season during 2012. Data comprise measurements in the water column ad different depth from surface to the bottom.

para.literalLayout: Algal cells are concentrated by filtering a known volume of water through a membrane filter (47 mm, 5.0 µm pore size). The pigments are extracted from the concentrated algal sample in an aqueous solution of acetone. The chlorophyll a concentration is determined spectrophotometrically by measuring the absorbance (optical density - OD) of the extract at various wavelengths. The resulting absorbance measurements are then applied to a standard equation.

section.para: In the point of maximum depth of the lake. Water samples are collected at different depths (surface, 1, 2.5, 5, 7.5, 10 and sometimes at 15 m depth) with a Niskin bottle and placed in a dark cooler box and packed in ice at the time of collection
